name: Orestes López
description: '''Orestes López Valdés''' (August 28, 1908 – January 26, 1991), nicknamed '''Macho''', was a Cuban multi-instrumentalist, composer and bandleader. As a [[double bass]]ist he was a founding member of the  Havana Philharmonic Orchestra, and later a member of the [[National Symphony Orchestra of Cuba]]. A long-time member of the [[Charanga (Cuba)|charanga]] [[Arcaño y sus Maravillas]], where he played cello and piano, he is considered the co-creator of the [[Mambo (music)|mambo]], together with his brother [[Cachao|Israel "Cachao" López]], and one of the most prolific [[danzón]] composers of the 20th century.
